Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris S
Reviews.Content: Clearly not a 3-star hotel as its sign indicates! The room are old and dirty. Though the hotel forbids smoking, the curtains and the desk in the room had burn stains and the hotel had the smell of tobacco. The personnel in the front desk has clearly no professional qualifications, being rude and obnoxious. I stayed for 3 nights and they did not change the bed sheets, nor cleaned the room. I did get fresh towels though. In general the room (and the hotel) was in desperate need of renovation! The hotel is centrally located and within walking (or tram) distance from the touristic squares and shopping center. If you only wish a good night sleep, then I would suggest staying in a cheaper place.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, well located and budget”
Reviews.Author: N0rway19
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very cheap, and well located. It is located just by the sentral station in Amsterdam, and the reseption was open 24/7. Friendly staff, who helped us book a resturant over the phone and etc. Nice big light rooms, we stayed as a couple for 5 nights. We had our own barthroom with bathtub and shower and WC. The room was cleaned before our stay, but it was a carpet floor, so staines from previous guests were ofcourse there. The bathroom was clean, we got new towels every second day. It was a bit noisy from the main road passing the room by, but it got more quiet in the night, and we slept trough it all. Breakfast was served in the lobby/reseption area, where you could get tea/coffie, juice and bread with jam or toast etc. The breakfast was included in the prise, and was til 10 am in the morning. Over all it is one of the most pleasent stayes I've had in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Low standard hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Sophia F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my work colleagues. The reviews made me really expect the worst from this hotel, however it was not too bad and the rooms were reasonable (I shared the triple room). They weren't dirty or smelly or anything else that has been mentioned, they were just in need of a revamp and for the price of the room I would stay here again. The hotel is right next to Amsterdam central station and within walking distance of all the sights so if you are looking for location then this is a good budget choice. Just don't expect too much and you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Had rat inside the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cheng M
Reviews.Content: My friends and I wanted to had a place near the train station and hope not to move again as this is the last two nights of our holidays in Europe. However, once we checked in the hotel, the hotel room was not as clean as a three star hotel should be. And guess what, the room in second floor had rats inside the room, the rats ate our chocolate and stroopwafels, when we informed the staff in front-desk the next morning, she told us this foods are attracting the rats, and this area have lots of rats. I told her then why no one inform us or any noticed that warn the guests about this issue, she just said she is sorry and they wont make any compensation for our losses. I had been travel for so many years and had never stay in a hotel with rats inside the room, and the room is at the 2nd floor,...... they only agreed to change another room for the 2nd night after requested by us,.... We requested to see the owner who suppose to come in later, but we guess he do not dare to face us so we didn't manage to meet him and ask for further explanation or compensation,... You may stay in this hotel if you want some rats to company you at night !!!! or hide inside your luggage and follow you home,...

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!! Rooms, service and price - Rip Off..”
Reviews.Author: Suzie B
Reviews.Content: We where charged nearly 300 euro a night due to a conference in Amsterdam at the time. I still cant believe that they felt ok about charging that price for a disgusting, dirty, bug invested room!! We had just completed 4 weeks backpacking in Europe and this was the worst place every.. We had a leaking shower and basin which made the carpet damp and awful smell, the fire alarm was hanging from the roof with wires everywhere, the room was dusty and the hotel staff where not helpful at all. If we could have moved we would have, I would not recomend this place to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Simon00164
Reviews.Content: Had 6 nights of misery at this hotel because rest of town fully booked due to conference. Changed rooms twice in first hour for various reasons but mainly as carpet in the first room was soaked because it had rained all day!! Would not recommend this hotel to anyone, in fact, strongly advise you do not stay here under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: adzthealien
Reviews.Content: The Season Star was adequate for our one night stay. The guy running the place wasn't exactly personable, but he wasn't rude either. Our room itself was clean, but the shower curtain was dirty and the drain looked like it hadn't been cleaned in forever. The room was small, but otherwise fine for what we paid. The free continental breakfast was pretty unimpressive, and the coffee was horrible instant stuff. The location was great though. Basically, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Oh. My. God.”
Reviews.Author: Sonia S
Reviews.Content: Amazing. Just amazing. It is so hard to find the words to describe this sensational experience. So. You walk into the lobby. It's INSANE. It's just breathtaking. There is a tiny statue of a crystal ship in the corner which reminded me of a song by the same name by the epic band The Doors (a coffee shop themed on this band is just around the corner). Our smoke detectors were already covered for us when we arrived ;). Granted, there was no breakfast service, but who needs breakfast service when you're living NEXT TO a delicious soup kitchen and the EXQUISIT dutch pancake house?! The elevator was comically slow, adding to the charm of this unique hotel. The floors were smothered with plush bourdeaux carpeting. The room itself was spacious , splendid and the beds were sensational. Ahh, the duvets and the pillows! What a dream. The bathroom had a relaxing bathtub and the showerhead massaged your scalp with a tender fortitude of incomparable tenor. The towels were like fluffy clouds. The view from our window was just so beautiful; rays of sunlight would filter in through the semi closed blinds in the morning, soothingly bathing our faces in a tranquil golden glow, awakening us at the start of each beautiful day. The location. Ohh, the location. Its awesomeness was unfathomable. Coffeeshops EVERYWHERE, as far as the eye could see. We were also convienently close to the station. The managment had a refreshingly relaxed guest policy; the receptionist even befriended our chinese guest, Bobby. Additionally, the internet works EVERYWHERE, and I do mean everywhere, even on the toilet seat. Its velocity was stunning. Hope you get the picture. SEASON STAR HOTEL FOR LIFE! Enjoy your stay. (WE DID!!!!!!!!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “YUK!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cindas_m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easily the worst hotel i've ever stayed in, I honestly didnt think hotels could be that bad!!! I shared a room with my mum and my aunt and uncle were in the room upstairs, luckily we hardly spent anytime in the room at all. As soon as we got in, we knew it would be bad. The lift is miniture, mega slow and makes loud groany noises. The lady on th desk was very friendly but the guy later on was sat, feet up on the stool no shoes, playing games on his laptop. Not the biggest problem but still. The bathroom clearly hadnt even been cleaned, there were still curly wurlys on the toilet seat...mmm nice!! We got the cleaner to come and reclean it!! We didnt even shower in there because the bottom of the shower and shower curtain were literally covered in mould!! Normally we take toiletries with us but the one time we both relyed on the other one to take stuff was the one time we got stuck in a hotel that didnt even have soap!! The carpet felt like it was covered in weird grease or something. The bed, in fairness was comfortable, but grossly old and unclean and I woke up with bites on my neck and hands, obviously from the pillows!! We could hear people in the next room, above and below! The side table was covered in white powder :S Everything in the room was broken, old and gross!! And the room was sooo small. To go on along with the broken curtain rail, window that wouldnt shut, only to look out to 3 grotty old buildings which were peoples homes. In the morning we had a lovely wakeup call to somebody walking into our 'locked' room and quickly walking back out again!! Followed by a phone call from the man at the desk at 10am simply saying 'Time to get out' hmmmm So stay the hell away from this rank hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever been”
Reviews.Author: Maxtheviper
Reviews.Content: Paid 262â‚¬ for a dirty, uncomfortable and small room. Tv not working, shower broken. Really unpleasant experience. I don't understand how an hotel like the can be a 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: sarahadele
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Season star for 4 nights with 3 friends. We paid an average Â£130 each for the whole stay. I cannot rate the location of this hotel highly enough, perfect walking distance to most places, didn't use a tram once. Right next to the central train station, which was perfect and we didn't get lost (amazingly). The hotel stairs are a bit scary, but there is a lift. The room was topped up with fresh towels and toilet paper and the beds made each day. Basic but good breakfast each morning. Lovely, friendly staff. Comfortable beds, not too cold or hot. The bathroom flooded a little after a shower but to be honest it really didn't matter. I don't understand all the bad reviews, at that sort of price what do you expect? I was 100% satisfied with my stay at the season star and will definitely recommend it to friends and stay there again. So if you're looking for somewhere with an amazing location (bars, coffee shops, restaraunts, museums) no frills and inexpensive, the season star really is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel, service and rats”
Reviews.Author: jallaballa096
Reviews.Content: the hotel looks ok in reseption. but my room was not cleaned, old and dirty. i got sick on my trip in amsterdam because of the dirty room. in the night there was a mouse/rat in our room running around eating on plastic bags. they wouldnt give us any money back. stay far far away from this hotel. i dont understand where they get 3 stars from.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, don't go if you're used to luxury!!”
Reviews.Author: Madashell247
Reviews.Content: My 2 night stay in amsterdam in this hotel was satisfactory, I recommend you argue the price and view the room as some of the other reviews suggest this is a bad hotel so maybe I was lucky coz my room was alright and there was nothing out of the ordinary going on there. But be warned I threw up on the floor haha... Shall I tell you which room?? 104

Reviews.Title: “this hotel wrecked my vacation”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworld24088
Reviews.Content: do not stay here.for the same price you can stay at a much better hotel. do not unless you dont want any sleep.it is very noisy .they wanted to charge me hundreds of dollars to change rooms.their was mouse poop all over my room.tons of it.my whole stay the owners and most staff were very rude,they lie about everything.my room was covered in mouse poop and a big fat mouse running around with me in the room looking at it.i tell the staff and i am told i am making it up and its my imagination .there is no wifi internet .they are lying .they told me all kinds of lies.like it comes and goes!!!well it never came ...also the breakfast was so bad.... i kinda ate it once.i was finally changed rooms and it was not much better .the shower wets the whole room i mean floods it .it is just a shower head in the middle of the bathroom not contained in anything....i have traveled all over the world and this place is the worst hotel i have ever stayed at.i even had a -do not disturb -sign on my door and at 7:00am the owners kid walks into my room and gives me fresh towels he knocked as he was throwing the door open.i called visa they said that they could not refund my money. i was very polite and calm whenever complaining.or asking about the internet and stuff .i have been to amsterdam 3 times . i have noticed that you have to be extra careful when choosing a hotel in amsterdam .i thought i would be okay here because of the pictures and it being 3stars WAS I EVER WRONG .i stayed at a hostel once and it was 100000000 times better then this place .if you go to amsterdam go upscale in this town it makes all the difference . i stayed at a 3 star golden tulip for a week.it was cheaper then season star by hundreds... the breakfast was awesome ,the staff was nice. front desk was was so helpful to every last person.but yup thats another review.

Reviews.Title: “Worst trip ever”
Reviews.Author: SeasonStarHater
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for a weekend trip at the Season Star hotel in Amsterdam. First, we saw the impressive website. This was one big reason why we booked this hotel... thinking we can't go wrong with a three star hotel. Then we arrived. OMG! The staff was stupid and completely incompetent for their job. When we checked in, only some of us got a key card for the rooms. The others had to ask the staff each time they wanted to get in their room. The elevator does definitely not comply with any European standard, so we decided to use the stairs because we are not suicidal. Later we saw the staff use the elevator to transport the garbage. The first time we entered the room, there was luggage from another hotel guest left in it. The room was not cleaned... there were dirty socks hanging in the open window (see pictures) and the bedding was not washed after the previous guest had left. It was supposed to be white, but actually it was grey and there was hair on it. A second window was so dirty that we could hardly see through it. Also, the wall beside the bed was covered with mildew (see picture) ... risk to health. Most power sockets were unsafe because the lines were wildly hanging around (see picture). The only safe looking socket was not usable because in the right connector was a broken plug. The "shower" was also full of mildew and in two of the rooms, the toilet was separated to the sleeping room only by a see-through saloon door. We had no soap and only half a roll of toilet paper. We tried talking to the staff because we wanted at least a discount. The receptionist was not willed to give a discount and also didn't let us talk to the hotel manager. The breakfast was rationed and disgusting. After first tasting it we decided to take breakfast elsewhere. By the way, the tables where the guests ate were used as a sleeping place by the night concierge. Long story short: DON'T GO THERE... you could better sleep on a bank in a park.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: HarrowALondon_UK
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have ever stayed in a worse hotel, it was shocking. I only stayed there because my normal hotel was full and there was nowhere else to stay due to a conference being on. The room was small, very damp, dirty and generally unpleasant. When I arrived the window was open even though it wasn't a very warm day. I found out why after I closed it as the smell of damp was horrible - I quickly opened the window again! The curtains didn't pull together, and there was a table in front of the window so the curtains rested on it. One door of the wardrobe didn't open because there was a table in front of it. There were 2 small wooden chairs in the room to sit on and the shower was dirty and broken with the shower curtain old and unclean. I didn't bother with breakfast which was served in the reception area as I couldn't get out of there fast enough. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and small room”
Reviews.Author: tatissi
Reviews.Content: The hotel pictures on website give a distorted image of the hotel.The rooms are relly very small and most of all dirty.The cleaning service is very poor and never change bed linenI stayed 1 week!!).The carpets dirty and all the furnitures...Be aware!I will never come back in this hotel.The only positive was the receptionists assistance:they always ask for excusing...

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: scuba414
Reviews.Content: very easy to book, good value for 4 of us, two clean twin rooms with adequate and clean bathroom facilities, very friendly service, good breakfast, would definitely recommend and/or book again. view wasn't much but again didn't go for the view out the window as did our sightseeing in the day.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel We've stopped in, in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jo1976
Reviews.Content: Me & my partner have just returned from our 24th Amsterdam visit, after 2 nights at the Season Star Hotel. We arrived on Sat 21st Feb at around 9am but was not allowed to book in till 2pm, which was ok as this normal with most hotels. When we got to the Hotel at around 2.15pm we was told that we could leave our bags in the room but could not stop as the room had not been finished by house keeping. This wasn't good news as we had been up since 4am and need to get our heads down for a few hours before going out that night. We went to our room which was the top floor of the hotel and the 1st thing i noticed was the smell, the room smelt like sewage and the smell was MUCH stronger in the bathroom. The 2nd thing i noticed was the front window had NO curtains or blinds, this is not good as i was under the impression that we was booked into a 3 star hotel and this DID NOT look or smell like a 3 star hotel. The 3rd thing i noticed in our 3 star hotel was the window pain was broken in the window at the side of the room. I didn't complain as i felt it wouldn't have gotten us anywhere and was only there for 2 nights, so we made do with it and tried not to be there as often as possible. We've been to Amsterdam 24 times in the past 7 years and we have never had a room like this one at the Season Star Hotel and we never will go back to this hotel in Amsterdam again. Please don't be fooled by the hotels GREAT looking website. On a good point and the only good point to this Hotel is it's location as it is in the heart of Amsterdam, but there are loads of other hotels in the heart of Amsterdam so try one of them :)

Reviews.Title: “Near railstation.”
Reviews.Author: EugeneDuck
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is ideally located two blocks from the Central Railroad station. (There is good rail service from airport to station.) My room was tiny, very tiny, but judging from the fire-escape outline floor map on the inside of the door, some of the rooms are bigger. Also I was a single traveler which I indicated when I made my reservation so I could have gotten a small room. The stairs to my room were steep, and the tread narrow for my big American feet, but I suspect this is the case with a lot of hotels in Amsterdam. However part of this hotel is serviced by an elevator so if one doesnâ€™t want to carry luggage up narrow stairs, then make sure you are in the right part of the hotel. My room was in back and quiet, but since the hotel is on a busy street, there might be some street noise in front rooms. Breakfast was good, but minimal. Personnel at the front desk spoke English and were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, central”
Reviews.Author: pizza&salsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week-end in Jan 2008. We had a twin room on the top floor (with lift) - room was at the back of hotel, so quiet. Small room with 2 beds pushed together, small bathroom but with new fittings, good shower, hairdrier, very clean. Beds were comfortable and clean. A/C worked well to warm the room. Small wardrobe space with a safe. Very good filling breakfast, good choice, continental breakfast, fresh croissants, ham+cheese+eggs.. We had no complaints and would recommend it and return. Yes the room is small, but we didn't stay in the room much, and hotel is just a short walk from the station and very central, trams stop nearby. Friendly staft at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're a non-claustraphobic pentathlete.”
Reviews.Author: mikhel
Reviews.Content: Got a room here at the last possible minute after booking a trip that coincided with Queens Day - the busiest weekend of the year. Given that l was relieved not to be sleeping under a bridge, I was probably more forgiving of this quirky hotel than I otherwise might have been. On the plus side the staff are quite friendly and the rooms are pretty clean. The Hotel is handily located for most of the obvious tourist sites and is also close to the railway station. The negatives are essentially down to the archaic dutch architecture that's such a feature of the area. The building is narrow and high which means that the rooms are tiny with little in the way of facilities. No views, not much natural light and quite stuffy. Worst of all, a significant number of the rooms can only be reached by means of staircases that seem to have been designed by MC Escher. The room we stayed in could only be reached on hands and knees - and that was before the consumption of a drop of alcohol! I don't know what the annual casualty rate is but given the condition of many of the late night revellers I observed I assume it's significant. Accomodation in Amsterdam is pretty expensive and this was no exception. The reality is you can expect to pay a lot for not very much. The Season Star was undoubtedly an unforgetable experience but I was very grateful that we were only staying for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Budget experience - less than budget price”
Reviews.Author: Silversurfer5956
Reviews.Content: Could not get any of the hotels we had been recommended because of a major conference in the city. Booked the Season Star out of desperation. Should have known better! The room allocated-206-was tiny. Supposed to be a twin it was a single room with two beds squeezed in. Two bedside tables including lamps shoved into a corner at the foot of one of the beds! Single wardrobe with 2 coat hangars until we complained when we were given 2 more!! Smoke alarm hanging from the ceiling, extractor fan in toilet/bathroom not working. 2 tortuous staircases up to the room-no lift in this part of the hotel. Redeeming features? Helpful staff within the narrow limitations of the place, reasonable breakfasts if you got there before 9.15am-not much left after that, including clean cutlery.Location was OK, accommodated bags on last day before travelling. For the price this was not a good deal by any stretch of the imagination. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we felt very let down by this experience. A and B. H. Lichfield, UK

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 21st bash!!!”
Reviews.Author: dooley888
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed at this hotel, it is really close to the train station, red light district and the major tramlines yet the hotel is not terribly noisey for such a central location! The beds were really comfortable, noted by all of us. Bathrooms, clean and well equipped with power shower, hairdryer, free shampoo etc. It didn't smell or look old, actually quite modern (as with rooms) We didn't eat breakfast so we can't comment on that. Staff were helpful but there was a slight language barrier but hey, can't complain about that, afterall we were speaking english and not their mother tongue! The reception was quick and well organised and the hotel remains open 24hours and the reception area was always clean and tidy. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: maryrose5
Reviews.Content: my daughter and myself stayed here in may 2006 and as a regular visitor to the city this was the best location and budget hotel i have stayed in very clean compact room breakfast was excellent and the staff were very polite and helpful taking time to point out the best tourist and travel information suitable for the hoildaymaker i would recommend this to anyone who wants a clean easy to get to budget hotel, for the price payed and the customer care it is first class next time back i will be staying here

Reviews.Title: “give season star a break”
Reviews.Author: StephTeeside
Reviews.Content: my boyfreind and i stayed at season star in october 05, i loved it, i agree the rooms were small and basic but they were very, very clean. i wanted to be close to the damrak and the station and i thought the location was fantastic. i would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality / Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently in this hotel for two days. The staff were very nice and welcoming, clean room (even a bit small) and good breakfast. Excellent location close to the center and the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!!”
Reviews.Author: andyandlorna
Reviews.Content: Absolute let down. This hotel is not in City centre as web site would have you believe, its quite a long tram ride away from centre.. I'm no prude, cheap and cheerful will do me BUT this 'hotel' was ridiculous. The room was absolutely tiny. No storage space whatsoever. The view of a canal as promised was unfortunately hidden by scaffolding and netting, that spanned the entire hotel frontage. And as for the 'SPECTACULAR' (their words not mine!!) dining room, what a joke. Small cramped and RATIONED!!. Only 1 cup of coffee(or tea) per person, tiny selection of cooked meats and bread rolls and to make things worse i was given an eating slot of 9.30 am, which meant half the morning was gone before i'd eaten. To be fair the 2 dining room staff were helpful and polite but that wont be enough to make me stay there again. I wish i'd read this site before i booked because i would have stayed elsewhere, and if your'e reading this seeking advice, mine would be GO ELSEWHERE!!!!!!!!. Andy. Preston. UK

HotelInfo.Name: Season Star Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Martelaarsgracht 18, Amsterdam 1012 TR, The Netherlands
